answers.answer: Hi,First of all RELAX,It is pretty difficult to RELAX I understand,in such conditions one should remain calm to diagnose and treat the ailment,anxiety and depression will only worsen the condition.In MS most your symptoms are present but it cannot be conclusive of MS, because there are many other disease that have the same symptoms of MS.Please take a second opinion and wait for your Neurosurgeon to get back to you.Meanwhile ,you can consult a GP to rule out other diseases.Goodluck
Get a second opinion.  Try the Mayo clinic or an MS specialist or a neuro at a teaching hospital.  You'll feel better hearing just more than just one opinion.

They have ruled out vasculiis, Lupus and every other thing you can imagine.  Where I live it is VERY difficult to get a second opinion.  I am waiting for a 2nd spinal tap...is that normal, to get a nother one.  Praer would be great,
Then travel.  You need a second set of eyes.  I think the second opinion is more important than the second spinal, in my opinion.
I'm working on it, unfortunately the spinal tap is arriving before I can go somewhere else, and it means quite a distance as well, not just a few hours away.

Again, I just told some one else- Lyme Disease testing is essential through a reliable lab. There are labs that specialize in tick borne diseases, one in Palo Alto California, where your blood can be sent.Your symptoms are all on the Lyme disease list.  Tick bites are often not seen, as ticks can be the size of a poppy seed and climb the body to the genitals, scalp, and other unseen areas. Lyme Disease causes a multitude of symptoms up to 75+.  Doctor's find it next to impossible to diagnose as lab testing is so unreliable it should be based on a clinical diagnosis. But most Md's can't figure out what is going on . There are Lyme literate Md's that are wise beyond most.  Lyme can mimic ALS, MS, Fibro and many,many more. It is the  fastest growing infectious disease surpassing Aids in the U.S.  There is reliable info out there lymenet, truthaboutlymedisease, ilads and more. Pleaes Trust me this needs to be ruled out by a reliable lab.

Ditto what Millerman said.  I would make an appt. with an MS specialist (neuroimmunologist).  I did this after seeing several general neuro's.  MS specialists are far more skilled at diagnosing or excluding MS and things that mimick MS.  I have a multitude of MS symptoms.  The specialist said no MS.  Also, if you can't ask your neuro questions what good is he or she?I also agree with what limabean said.  Lyme can cause all of this.
